ygData.subject: RE: Lullaby interrupting casters
ygData.msgSnippet: If you are encountering a single creature then by all means bellow would be the way to go. It interrups about as fast and it does damage. If you are in a group
ygData.messageBody:
If you are encountering a single creature then by all means bellow would be
the way to go. It interrups about as fast and it does damage. If you are in
a group fighing a single creature chances are it would not sleep for very
long anyway not to mention the side effect of it attacking YOU when it wakes
up. For multiple mobs, however, I'd go with the lullaby for taking the rest
of them out of the fight for a while.

Good Journey,

Sineras Silverlyre (Cazic-Thule)


8)-----Original Message-----
8)From: Llewrend Lynnhaven [mailto:lordartos@...]
8)Sent: Tuesday, August 03, 1999 8:18 AM
8)To: eqbards@onelist.com
8)Subject: RE: [eqbards] Lullaby interrupting casters
8)
8)
8)From: Llewrend Lynnhaven <lordartos@...>
8)
8)
8)Yeah, since I orginaly started this thread I did a few
8)duels with my wizzie friend. We are both 23. She had
8)a good strategy, she was doing her random teleport
8)then waiting for me to run at here to blast and
8)teleport again. Lullabye was sucking, so I switched
8)to bellow. That made all the difference. Every time
8)it hit it interupted her, and at a much faster rate
8)that lullabye does AND I never saw a resist message
8)for it come up. So for now at least, I go start off
8)with the guardian/purifying to try and resist the
8)first blast then get in close with fast weapons and bellow.
